citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, there was no documented program of environmental enhancement available for review, for the
non-human primates housed at the facility.
An adequate environmental enhancement program is essential in promoting the psychological well-being of non-human
primates.
Dealers. Exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan for environment
enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of non-human primates. This plan must be made
available to APHIS upon request. To be corrected by November 22, 2024.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, there was no documented program of environmental enhancement available for review, for the
birds housed at the facility.
An adequate environmental enhancement program is essential in promoting the psychological well-being of birds.
Dealers. Exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for
environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. This plan must be made available
to APHIS upon request. To be corrected by November 22, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

3.81 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
At the time of inspection, there was no documented program of environmental enhancement available for review, for the 
non-human primates housed at the facility.  
 
An adequate environmental enhancement program is essential in promoting the psychological well-being of non-human

Dealers. Exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan for environment 
enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of non-human primates. This plan must be made

3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
At the time of inspection, there was no documented program of environmental enhancement available for review, for the 
birds housed at the facility.  
 
An adequate environmental enhancement program is essential in promoting the psychological well-being of birds. 
 
Dealers. Exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for 
environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. This plan must be made available

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
